summary: The Rural Health Care Access Act of 2025 aims to amend Title XVIII of the Social Security Act to permit states to designate rural facilities as critical access hospitals without mileage limitations. The bill focuses on modifications to the Medicare Rural Hospital Flexibility Program, specifically addressing designations and redesignations of hospitals within rural areas. The legislation clarifies the process for designation and sets the effective date for the amendments to impact designations made on or after the enactment date.
